intro: Androsace cuttingii, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in early spring. Androsace cuttingii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
